intro: [WRONG START] Hieracium aurantium subsp. pseudaurantiacum, commonly known as the orange hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright orange to yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. It is a perennial herb that spreads through rhizomes and is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain regions.
